page.title: 04THE CANAL THROUGH FLEET
page.content: The{Basingstoke canal,}which flows through Fleet, is undergoing extensive {restoration work,}with probably five years work to complete. Approximately 750 boats will be licensed to use the canal this year. The pressure of pedestrian use is causing a need to re-surface the towpath within the next few years. Amongst the activities that local people make of the canal are fishing, walking, swimming and canoeing. The{danger}to local children {of drowning}in the canal has caused many people to demand a swimming pool in Fleet but, up the present time, the local council says a pool would be too expensive for public money. An action group, The{Hart Swimming Association,} was founded in 1980 and is campaigning for the provision of a community pool, jointly financed between the Hart Council and other bodies.
